intro: Helianthemum triflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered rockrose, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cistaceae. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. Native to southern Europe and North Africa, it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often used in landscaping for its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
